title: How to Make Washi Tape Eggs

parts.name: Selecting Washi tape and a design

steps.headline: Choose a selection of suitable Washi tape.
steps.description: You might like to focus on pastel colors for an Easter theme. Or, choose Washi tape that you just happen to like the designs of. You can even make your own washi tape if you want a custom made one.

steps.headline: Choose a design approach for the egg.

parts.name: Applying Washi tape to the egg

steps.headline: Cut or tear the strips of Washi tape.
steps.description: The pieces will need to be long enough to go around the egg or to extend from top to bottom. Remove the adhesive from the back, ready to stick onto the egg.

steps.headline: Apply the tape in the chosen pattern.
steps.description: Follow your original design to make up the egg.

steps.headline: Repeat until all of the design has been added to the egg.
steps.description: Finish off the last piece tidily, ensuring that all of the egg has been covered neatly.

steps.headline: Make more eggs to create a collection.
steps.description: Choose matching Washi tape for the best effect.

text:
Selecting Washi tape and a design Choose a selection of suitable Washi tape. You might like to focus on pastel colors for an Easter theme. Or, choose Washi tape that you just happen to like the designs of. You can even make your own washi tape if you want a custom made one. Choose a design approach for the egg. The Washi tape can be added in various ways: Place strips from the top of the egg to the bottom of the egg. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the strips around the middle of the egg. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/10/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the strips around the middle of the egg and other strips from top to bottom of the egg, to make a cross effect. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Place the strips diagonally across the egg. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/81/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet4.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Wrap the egg like a mummy, or any which way. This is ideal for young children; let them do it however they fancy. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet5.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet5.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-2Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Try drawing designs on paper and using small pieces of Washi tape on the paper if you're not quite sure what you'll like. When you're happy with the design choice, proceed to the next part. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-3.jpg/v4-459px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f1/Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-3.jpg/v4-759px-Make-Washi-Tape-Eggs-Step-3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":506.31868131868134,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Applying Washi tape to the egg Cut or tear the strips of Washi tape. The pieces will need to be long enough to go around the egg or to extend from top to bottom. Remove the adhesive from the back, ready to stick onto the egg. Apply the tape in the chosen pattern. Follow your original design to make up the egg. Repeat until all of the design has been added to the egg. Finish off the last piece tidily, ensuring that all of the egg has been covered neatly. Make more eggs to create a collection. Choose matching Washi tape for the best effect.
